metadata.title: CVE-2017-7982 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Integer overflow in the plist_from_bin function in bplist.c inlibimobiledevice/libplist before 2017-04-19 allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read and applicationcrash) via a crafted plist file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7982` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libplist++3v5 - 1.12-3.1ubuntu0.16.04.1
libplist-utils - 1.12-3.1ubuntu0.16.04.1
libplist3 - 1.12-3.1ubuntu0.16.04.1
python-plist - 1.12-3.1ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libplist package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.12-3.1ubuntu0.16.04.1').
